title: Establishing the Task Force on Missing and Murdered American Indians and Alaska Natives

enrichment.summary: This executive order establishes a federal task force to help address the problem of missing and murdered American Indians and Alaska Natives, especially women and girls. The task force coordinates federal agencies and tribal governments to improve investigations, share data, and increase public awareness about these cases.
potential_concerns: The interagency coordination could lead to jurisdictional confusion or delays, potentially hampering timely investigations affecting Native American and Alaska Native women and girls.
Tribal governments might face challenges ensuring their sovereignty and input are fully respected within a federal task force primarily composed of federal agency officials.
Data sharing protocols across federal, state, local, and tribal agencies may raise privacy concerns and mistrust among Native communities regarding the handling of sensitive information.
The task forceâ€™s limited two-year term could impede sustained progress on addressing the complex issue of missing and murdered Indigenous persons in tribal communities.
Outreach and education campaigns might inadequately address rural and urban differences in tribal communities, reducing effectiveness in diverse Native populations.
